physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white portrait photograph. It features two men, both carrying cannisters. The man on the left is squatting on the ground, while the man on the right is standing and carrying the cannisters on a stick on his shoulder. Both are wearing loose tops and trousers, with a wrap cloth around the waist. The photograph is quite faded and stained. There are no inscriptions, tears, or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: "This is part of a series of small carte de visite format portrait photographs by August Sachtler, a German photographer who started photographing in Singapore in the early 1860s. The studio details inscribed on the back of these cartes de visite read ""A. Sachtler in Singapore""
title_text: Series of six carte de visite portraits by August Sachtler Photograph of two water carriers
subject_terms_1: indigenous people ways of life folk costume occupations (livelihoods) portraits
subject_terms_2: Carte de visite photographs Portrait photography Indigenous people Lifestyles Ethnic costume Occupations
